People who have recently talked to me might have noticed that I can't shut-up about Four Brothers. So of course i can't write an entry without blurting everything out:

Movie: Four Brothers

Stars: Mark Wahlberg, Tyrese Gibson, Andre Benjamin (Andre 3000), Garrett Hedlund

Tagline: They came to bury their mother... and her killer.

Review: This movie actually got me confused the first time (yes I watched it twice in a row) because, believe it or not, there is a lot of business stuff involved. Stuff about having to pay off business partners who shut them down, blah blah blah ( i won't say which brother gets caught up in this the most). It plays out like an old western in the end 'cause there's a "showdown at high noon" type of thing. But then again this movie is based loosely on a John Wayne movie so this is to be expected. I really liked this movie because it's funny, it has great music, it has great shooting sequences and the guys are hot! The brothers aren't gun-toting idiots who shoot people 'cause they want to, though. Their only objective is to kill their mother's killer. My only problem with this movie is that the characters are soooooo underdeveloped. We get a mini-profile of each of them and nothing else. ( in age order from oldest to youngest) Bobby Mercer just got out of prison (why he was in prison in the first place is a mystery). Jeremiah Mercer is the only brother doing ok, has a house, a wife and two daughters. Angel Mercer is an ex-marine and they mentioned that he wanted to get away from his life so he joined (why did he want to get away? idunno). Jack Mercer (and my favorite) is a "first-class fuck up and a third class rocker"(Officer Greene) lololol. But apparently, "they"(who's they?) did some "horrible things" to Jack before he was adopted by Evelyn Mercer (the mother). What are those horrible things? No clue? Then again, i suppose if they put in all of that the movie would be four hours long instead of its two and a half.

Bottom line: Far from being Oscar-worthy, but definitely worth the 10 bucks you'll spend to watch it.

OMG... I was reading my weekly TIME magazine and I skimmed the table of contents and saw a picture of a guy and I thought "Hmm, he looks vaguely familiar..." (mind you the face was kinda fuzzy). So I just shrugged and went on to read. I had just finished an article on endangered species of bears when I turned the page and there was (in all his beautiful glory) a one-page spread of Ralph Fiennes. *drool* I think I stared at that picture for a good ten minutes before I realized there was an article about him next to it.

Yeah, I know you don't care. But it's still summer! The point is to read other people's pointless crap.

Following up on my serious, serious Ralph Fiennes obsession (i finally found out how to pronounce his name correctly: Rayfe Fines) I was so happy when i found Quiz Show in the library. So, being that i haven't reviewed a movie in a long time, here it is: Movie: Quiz Show Director: Robert Redford (Ordinary People) Stars: John Tuturro, Ralph Fiennes, Rob Morrow Review: This movie is fascinating if you like stuff from the late fifties, early sixties. It is about the controversy that surrounded the extremely popular game show, Twenty One in the early sixties. I haven't really researched the actual scandal, but according to the movie, the producers fed the contestants answers and when the ratings dropped, they got the current champion to pretend to lose so that they could get a "fresh" (usually better looking) champion. Tuturro plays Herbie Stempel, a smart, nerdy guy who just keeps winning and winning and winning. But the producers "fire" him for the wealthy, upperclass, famous, VERY VERY goodlooking :D Charles Van Doren (Ralph Fiennes). The most interesting part of this movie is not so much the actual game show problems, it's the contestants motivations to play. Stempel is made off by the public as a guy who wants nothing but money because he isn't rich (lives in the dumps of NY), is Jewish, and is kinda ugly. In the beginning, even I as a viewer was fooled by Van Doren's kind demeanor and his concern that his playing on the show was from dishonest procedures. All he wanted to do was allow children to see that learning is fun. But then, his intentions become muddled as the money begins to come in and he realizes that the better he does in the show, the prouder his father is of him. There is a underlining message about racism that is subtly placed in and i feel that if they had played that up a bit, it would have been even better. However, I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. and if you don't want to watch it for the movie plot, then watch it for Ralph Fiennes!!! Sorry boys, not much in it for you if you're not interested in the story (unless you're gay. then you TOTALLY lucked out!!:D) Note: Ralph Fiennes can do just about every accent except american. it is so freakin' shitty! Note Note: His voice is kinda nasaly too, but still hot!!

What does my birthday mean?
apparently:
Your Birthdate: July 29 
Your birthday on the 29th adds a tone of idealism to your nature. 
You are imaginative and creative, but rather uncomfortable in the business world. 
You are very aware and sensitive, with outstanding intuitive skills and analytical abilities. 

The 29 reduces to 11, one of the master numbers which often produces much nervous tension. 
This is the birthday of the dreamer rather than the doer. 
You do, however, work very well with people. 

How does 29 reduce to 11? Or are they just implying i'm stupid?

Wow, it's been a while, huh? Well, here's my useless entry for the month: I have recently taken a sort of fanaticism to Ralph Fiennes. For all you Harry Potter fans, you already know that he will be playing THE Lord Voldemort in the upcoming GoF film. Here's his villain record: Schindler's List (1993)- psychopathic Nazi commandant, Amon Goethe Red Dragon (2002)- crazed, lunatic, misunderstood serial killer, Francis "The Tooth Fairy" Dolarhyde And after two Academy Award and several Golden Globe nominations, several BAFTA (british version of the oscars) wins, perhaps his most evil villain of all... Jennifer Lopez's love interest in Maid in Manhattan (2002)... BARF Sigh, oh well, Ralph Fiennes is still gorgeous and he has quite a resume. So, I don't doubt that he will make a fabulous Lord Voldemort. I just hope he doesn't tie himself down to HP for the next like six years. Schindler's List Red Dragon

Has the sweet breeze blown?

To see my world below.
And I laugh at myself
While the tears roll down.
'Cause it's the world I know.
It's the world I know.

Have you all heard my "(edit out tactless words, thanks huy for telling me)" theory? Most of you probably have, but for those who haven't, here's a quick overview:

There are two objects heading towards each other. You are watching them. When they crash, things break. Do you look away? Most likely not. Why? Because, as terrible as it is, you want to see what happens next.

And thus i come to my point. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (the movie) is that crash I can't look away from. I have my hands over my eyes, and every once in a while I take a glance and regret doing so right after. I could have died happy knowing that they only made three Harry Potter movies. But noooooo, they just keep chugging along. I DESPISE IT. I DESPISE THE FACT THAT DAVID HEYMAN KEEPS THINKING THAT DAN, RUPERT, EMMA, TOM, ETC. WILL MIRACULOUSLY STOP AGING. I DESPISE THE FACT THAT THE COSTUME AND SET DESIGNERS AND STEVE KLOVES ARE SUCKING ALL THE MAGIC OUT OF A MAGIC SCHOOL.

FOR GOODNESS SAKES, EMMA IS NEARLY FIFTEEN, DAN IS NEARLY SIXTEEN, RUPERT IS ALREADY SEVENTEEN, AND TOM IS TURNING EIGHTEEN. WHY THE HELL ARE THEY PLAYING FOURTEEN YEAR OLDS???

AND ANOTHER THING, THESE KIDS WEAR ROBES. NOT STREET CLOTHES!!!! THEY GO TO SCHOOL AT HOGWARTS!!! DAVID CROSSMAN!!!! YOU'RE THE COSTUME SUPERVISOR!!!! DO SOMETHING!!!!!

DAMN YOU ALL!!!!!!! (but particularly David Heyman)

Nearly Headless Nick
In the first draft of 'Chamber of Secrets', Nick sang a self-penned ballad explaining how his head had (nearly) come off. My editor was not very fond of the song and so I cut it. However, for those who are curious, here is the story of Nick's decapitation in his own moving words.- JK Rowling

It was a mistake any wizard could make
Who was tired and caught on the hop
One piffling error, and then, to my terror,
I found myself facing the chop.
Alas for the eve when I met Lady Grieve
A-strolling the park in the dusk!
She was of the belief I could straighten her teeth
Next moment she'd sprouted a tusk.
I cried through the night that I'd soon put her right
But the process of justice was lax;
They'd brought out the block, though they'd mislaid the rock
Where they usually sharpened the axe.
Next morning at dawn, with a face most forlorn,
The priest said to try not to cry,
"You can come just like that, no, you won't need a hat,"
And I knew that my end must be nigh.
The man in the mask who would have the sad task
Of cleaving my head from my neck,
Said "Nick, if you please, will you get to your knees,"
And I turned to a gibbering wreck.
"This may sting a bit" said the cack-handed twit
As he swung the axe up in the air,
But oh the blunt blade! No difference it made,
My head was still definitely there.
The axeman he hacked and he whacked and he thwacked,
"Won't be too long", he assured me,
But quick it was not, and the bone-headed clot
Took forty-five goes 'til he floored me.
And so I was dead, but my faithful old head
It never saw fit to desert me,
It still lingers on, that's the end of my song,
And now, please applaud, or you'll hurt me.

In other news:
Who wants to help this poor html, css illiterate child start up a movie review site? More than half the credit will go to you. Leave a comment if interested.

In other other news:
I was flipping through my old "writings" folder and found some old stuff i was writing in like seventh grade and stuff. Good ideas, really pathetic grammar and description. I'm proud to say I have advanced forward. But I digress. I looked at my "Maistre of Vampires" story that i was really into writing last year (got like 35 pages worth of text). Then i stopped, tried to start but couldn't. Serious case of writer's block. Who wants to help out? Basic, "i don't give a shit" summary:
girl hates world
girl wants to become a vampire
girl meets vampire
girl becomes vampire
vampire and girl fall in love
girl doesn't know that vampire loves her for a different reason
girl finds out
girl abandons vampire
vampire's "brother" (also a vampire) finds girl desolate
vampire bro and girl fall in love (like real love)
(insert a bunch of mythology and history, etc.)
girl finds out that she hates both vampires and runs away and wants to die, but cant cuz she's immortal

Er, i don't think the story is as pathetic as it sounds. I think (and I might be biased here) it's pretty good, just rough around the edges. But i really don't know what to do with the girl now. I don't really wanna kill her off, cause i have a special ending in mind. and i REALLY DON'T WANT HER TO RE-FALL IN LOVE WITH EITHER OF THE VAMPIRES. and if you, reader are still reading this, you must be really bored. So I'll stop.

In other, other, other news:
Both the creed project and I-search project suck

lol, I'm doing an interactive poll. here's the scenario:

Today, we were watching a badminton video during practice in the mat room. Obviously, no one was paying attention. So, ephie, jeffrey, me and rachelle were sitting in a row in the corner (in that order). They had turned off the lights so it was pretty dark except for the light coming from the TV. I reach down to scratch my leg and look up and Rachelle is giving me this "wtf" look. So i said, "What?" and there was a pause. Then suddenly, i guess something clicked in her mind and she was like "Oh! See, I thought jeffrey had reached over and was scratching your leg." Now, keep in mind this entire time, Rachelle knew full well that jeffrey had both his arms around ephie.

The Ultimate Family Feud (lol, written, courtesy of C. Lao)

For up to 2 players at a time.

Instructions: Place two gongs or cymbals, one on each opposite end of the room. Arm players with sticks. Players must stand ready at opposite ends of the room. Allow no more than 2 players to attack at once. Fire question. Players must charge to the opposite wall and ring the gong there in order to answer. First player to make serious noise will have the privilege of answering question.

BONUS POINTS: (May occur during the trip from one side of the room to another.)
5 points if you knock out your opponent.
10 points if you break a bone.
15 points if we see blood or a limb is torn off.
20 points if you can send the other guy to heaven.
25 points if you can send him to hell.
30 points if the guy comes back from the dead and strangles you. (Ghosts and zombies included.)

[created by T. Zhu and C. Lao]

Watched the Golden Globes last night. Most deserved it. Some didn't. My Take: Motion Pictures: Picture, Drama: "The Aviator." WTF?!?!? Million Dollar Baby was better!!! Actor, Drama: Leonardo DiCaprio, "The Aviator." Meh. Actress, Drama: Hilary Swank, "Million Dollar Baby." I'm VERY proud her Picture, Musical or Comedy: "Sideways." yay, though i was rooting for Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind Actor, Musical or Comedy: Jamie Foxx, "Ray." He deserves it Actress, Musical or Comedy: Annette Bening, "Being Julia." Shrug, never watched it. Supporting Actor: Clive Owen, "Closer." YEAH!!!!! Supporting Actress: Natalie Portman, "Closer." Very happy for her, but i was expecting it. Director: Clint Eastwood, "Million Dollar Baby." I think Million Dollar Baby is synonymous with "YAY!" Screenplay: Alexander Payne and Jim Taylor, "Sideways." Of course Original Score: Howard Shore, "The Aviator." No duh, lol Original Song: "Old Habits Die Hard" from "Alfie," by Mick Jagger and David A. Stewart. This song is the best!!! Foreign Language: "The Sea Inside," Spain. Havent seen any of them, so i shouldnt pass judgement. ___ Television: Drama Series: "Nip/Tuck," FX. YES!!!! Actor, Drama: Ian McShane, "Deadwood." Never watched it Actress, Drama: Mariska Hargitay, "Law & Order: Special Victims Unit." No interest. Musical or Comedy Series: "Desperate Housewives," ABC. IT SURE IS! Actor, Musical or Comedy: Jason Bateman, "Arrested Development." I bet i wasn't the only one cheering for this one. Actress, Musical or Comedy: Teri Hatcher, "Desperate Housewives." BOO!!! BOOO!!! BOOOOOOO!!!! Marcia Cross is waaaaay better. Miniseries or TV Movie: "The Life and Death of Peter Sellers," HBO. Lolololololol, very funny movie! Actor, Miniseries or TV Movie: Geoffrey Rush, "The Life and Death of Peter Sellers." and he did a great job in it! Actress, Miniseries or TV Movie: Glenn Close, "The Lion in Winter." never watched it. Supporting Actor, Series, Miniseries or TV Movie: William Shatner, "Boston Legal." WEEEHHEEEEHEEE!!!!! T.J. Hooker is the coolest guy ever!!! Supporting Actress, Series, Miniseries or TV Movie: Anjelica Huston, "Iron Jawed Angels." WANTED TO WATCH, SIGH!!! ___ Cecil B. DeMille Award: Robin Williams. lololol his speech was really funny, and he's got a good thing going.
